content.body: Yes, I think we should specify that, at the top level of the module, it's always a host-provided context (not necessarily empty--the host can put things there) and *not* based on what dynamic import triggered it (which would be racy)
content.formatted_body: Yes, I think we should specify that, at the top level of the module, it's always a host-provided context (not necessarily empty--the host can put things there) and not based on what dynamic import triggered it (which would be racy)

content.body: in some super high level way, this is 'registration time' rather than 'call time' (it's the context of the module registry, not the dynamic import)
